cell.steptitle: Bowtie 2 Support Package for Bioinformatics Toolbox
cell.mcode: % Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner. It aligns % short DNA sequences (reads) to the human genome at a rate of over 25 % million 35-bp reads per hour. Bowtie indexes the genome with a % Burrows-Wheeler index to keep its memory footprint small: typically about % 2.2 GB for the human genome (2.9 GB for paired-end). % % This support package installs the compiled binaries for Bowtie 2 so that they % can be used with Bioinformatics Toolbox (TM) in MATLAB. % % Bowtie 2 [1] was originally developed by Ben Langmead and Cole Trapnell at % Johns Hopkins University and the project is maintained at their website % [2]. % % [1] - Langmead B, Salzberg S. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. % Nature Methods. 2012, 9:357-359. % [2] - http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/index.shtml % % See also BOWTIE2, BOWTIE2BUILD, BOWTIE2INSPECT, BOWTIE2ALIGNOPTIONS, % BOWTIE2BUILDOPTIONS, BOWTIE2INSPECTOPTIONS.

mwsh:code.mwsh:comments: % Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner. It aligns
% short DNA sequences (reads) to the human genome at a rate of over 25
% million 35-bp reads per hour. Bowtie indexes the genome with a
% Burrows-Wheeler index to keep its memory footprint small: typically about
% 2.2 GB for the human genome (2.9 GB for paired-end).
% This support package installs the compiled binaries for Bowtie 2 so that they
% can be used with Bioinformatics Toolbox (TM) in MATLAB.
% Bowtie 2 [1] was originally developed by Ben Langmead and Cole Trapnell at
% Johns Hopkins University and the project is maintained at their website
% [1] - Langmead B, Salzberg S. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2.
% See also BOWTIE2, BOWTIE2BUILD, BOWTIE2INSPECT, BOWTIE2ALIGNOPTIONS,

mscript.originalCode:
%% Bowtie 2 Support Package for Bioinformatics Toolbox
% Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner. It aligns % short DNA sequences (reads) to the human genome at a rate of over 25 % million 35-bp reads per hour. Bowtie indexes the genome with a % Burrows-Wheeler index to keep its memory footprint small: typically about % 2.2 GB for the human genome (2.9 GB for paired-end). % % This support package installs the compiled binaries for Bowtie 2 so that they % can be used with Bioinformatics Toolbox (TM) in MATLAB. % % Bowtie 2 [1] was originally developed by Ben Langmead and Cole Trapnell at % Johns Hopkins University and the project is maintained at their website % [2]. % % [1] - Langmead B, Salzberg S. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. % Nature Methods. 2012, 9:357-359. % [2] - http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/index.shtml % % See also BOWTIE2, BOWTIE2BUILD, BOWTIE2INSPECT, BOWTIE2ALIGNOPTIONS, % BOWTIE2BUILDOPTIONS, BOWTIE2INSPECTOPTIONS.
% Copyright 2021 The MathWorks, Inc.
